column1: Section 48(3) of the Partition Law states that;
3) The interlocutory decree and the final decree of partition entered in a
partition  action  shall  have  the  final  and  conclusive  effect  declared  by
subsection  (1)  of  this  section  notwithstanding  the  provisions  of  section
44 of the Evidence Ordinance, and accordingly such provisions shall not
The powers of the Court of Appeal by way of revision and restitution in
integrum shall not be affected by the provisions of this subsection.
